name: OutRun Europa
description: The third game in the OutRun series, which revolutionised the third-person perspective style of racing games. The levels are set across Europe, as you bid to escape from the police. Unlike other titles in the series, you use a different vehicle on each level, with motorbikes and jet-skis adding variety and taking different skill to use. You must complete each level within the strict time limits, and the routes are dogged with other vehicles to avoid and overtake. You can choose between sound effects or music.
alsoFor: Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Game Gear, SEGA Master System | Combined View

shot.caption: After loading for a while the game instructed me to 'stop the tape and press fire'
Load screen 2, after pressing FIRE tyhe game wants the tape restarting
The start of the game. Steal a bike and chase the bad guys. No idea who they are or what they've done but, hey, its a good excuse for a chase.
Unfortunately there's another 'Start the tape', 'Stop the tape and press fire' load sequence before the game actually gets underway
We're off. There are other road users to avoid. No sign of a gun yet.
I think the obstacle I just carefully avoided was actually extra fuel
A helpful arrow in the sky shows the way to go
It is possible to go off-road - to a degree - and hit buildings
Some of the cars are police cars and should not be crashed into
The Hurry Up sign in the sky indicates that there's some kind of time limit
... and what does 'Hurrying Up' get me, pulled over by the police and one life gone
